data.title: Thai Airways cancels Taipei flights as Taiwan prepares for Typhoon Kong-rey
data.description: Thai Airways International suspended three flights to and from Taipei on Thursday and one on Friday due to the approach of Typhoon Kong-rey.

data.title: Insights into Thai Moms’ Online Shopping Behaviour
data.description: While product quality and price are the primary factors that win brand loyalty from Thai moms—up to 79% are loyal to a brand because of these factors—service quality is the real game-changer. It’s a key driver that could cause them to abandon a brand. Only 36% of moms will stick with a brand if they receive satisfactory service, but if the service is disappointing, 43% of loyal moms are ready to “converse” with other brands.

data.title: RML and Euro Creations Unveil Poltrona Frau Experience
data.description: RML (Raimon Land Public Company Limited), a leader in luxury and ultra-luxury real estate development in Thailand, has partnered with Euro Creations, a premier provider of luxury furniture and lifestyle products, to introduce the iconic Italian brand, Poltrona Frau, through the ‘Exclusive Unveiling of the Poltrona Frau Bangkok’. The event marked the opening of the new Monobrand Store of Poltrona Frau, imported by Euro Creations, located on Thonglor Soi 5. RML

data.title: Vietnam jails blogger snatched from Thailand
data.description: A Vietnamese  blogger  who was reportedly  abducted  from Thailand last year has been sentenced to 12 years in prison for disseminating anti-party and anti-state content, according to local media reports.

data.title: Deadly bus tragedy prompts Thai transport safety debate
data.description: The   bus fire  tragedy  that claimed the lives of 20 students and three teachers and left several injured on Tuesday has sparked a  debate  on whether education trips for students should be banned altogether. However, some argue that field trips remain an important part of students

data.title: Thailand Advances Digital Transformation with Huawei Cloud Stack Partnership
data.description: Huawei Cloud Stack provides innovative technology and cloud-enabled government services to propel Thailand towards becoming a regional cloud hub.

data.title: Most Thais think govt will survive until term ends: poll
data.description: Most Thai people are of the opinion that the government of Prime Minister Paetongtarn “Ung Ing” Shinawatra will be able to last until the end of its mandate in four years

data.title: Failure of lese majeste bid 'disappointing'
data.description: Chaithawat Tulathon, the ex-leader of the now-defunct Move Forward Party, on Friday expressed disappointment after the House rejected the proposal to include lese majeste in the list of offences that would be pardoned under a new political amnesty bill.

data.title: Opposition wants to cancel Thaksin's joint resources MoU with Cambodia
data.description: The opposition Palang Pracharath Party (PPRP) wants Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra to revoke a  2001 memorandum of understanding  between Thailand and Cambodia on  joint development  of oil and gas resources in a  disputed area  of the Gulf of Thailand.

data.title: Debate on charter rewrite bills in next House session
data.description: Parliament will debate charter amendment bills when it convenes its next session in December, House Speaker Wan Muhammad Noor Matha confirmed on Monday.

data.title: Thai charter referendum 'likely delayed'
data.description: Nikorn Chamnong, a member of the joint House-Senate panel on the  charter referendum  bill, said on Wednesday he no longer expects the public vote to take place in  February  as planned.

data.title: House rejects S112 inclusion
data.description: The House of Representatives on Thursday rejected the proposal to include lese majeste in the list of offences that would be pardoned under a new political amnesty bill, with 270 MPs voting against the offence

data.title: Minister counters push to void MoU with Cambodia
data.description: Defence Minister Phumtham Wechayachai denounced a move by political activists to petition the Constitutional Court to revoke a 2001 memorandum of understanding (MoU) between Thailand and Cambodia, established during the administration of former prime minister Thaksin Shinawatra.
